skill.name: zig-docs
skill.description: Fetches Zig language and standard library documentation via CLI. Activates when needing Zig API details, std lib function signatures, or language reference content that isn't covered in zig-best-practices.
skill.summary: Fetches Zig language and standard library documentation via CLI. Activates when needing Zig API deta...
skill.author: 0xBigBoss

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure documentation/guide file containing only markdown instructions. It does not contain any executable code, does not make network requests, does not access the filesystem beyond its own file, and does not execute any external commands. The skill provides reference guidance for fetching Zig documentation.

content.value_statement: Need Zig API details or std lib function signatures. This skill provides commands to fetch Zig language and standard library documentation from authoritative GitHub sources.
actual_capabilities: Fetch Zig standard library source with doc comments from GitHub
Retrieve language reference content from ziglang.org using pandoc
List all std lib modules via GitHub API
Extract function documentation and signatures from Zig source
Access version-specific documentation for stable releases
limitations: Does not provide interactive documentation search within the terminal
Requires curl, pandoc, and jq installed on the system
HTML documentation at ziglang.org is JavaScript-rendered and cannot be fetched directly

use_cases.title: Look up std lib API
use_cases.description: Quickly fetch function signatures and documentation for std lib modules like mem, fs, or log.

use_cases.title: Read language reference
use_cases.description: Access the Zig language reference and beginner guide for learning the language syntax and concepts.

use_cases.title: Get Zig help
use_cases.description: Enable Claude to fetch authoritative Zig documentation when writing or reviewing Zig code.

prompt_templates.title: Fetch std lib module
prompt_templates.scenario: Need documentation for a specific module
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the documentation for the Zig std lib [module_name] module, including function signatures and doc comments.

prompt_templates.title: Look up function
prompt_templates.scenario: Need details about a specific function
prompt_templates.prompt: Find documentation for [function_name] in the Zig standard library and show its signature and usage.

prompt_templates.title: Language reference
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch the Zig language reference section about [topic] and explain the key concepts.

prompt_templates.title: Version-specific docs
prompt_templates.scenario: Need docs for a specific Zig version
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the Zig [version] documentation for the [module/function] from the official release.

output_examples.input: Get the documentation for Zig's ArrayList implementation
output: Common operations: init, deinit, append, pop, iterator

best_practices: Use raw.githubusercontent.com for std lib source - most reliable with doc comments
Specify version tags (e.g., 0.14.0) for stable documentation across sessions
Pipe to grep and head for quick lookups instead of fetching full files
anti_patterns: Avoid fetching JavaScript-rendered HTML docs from ziglang.org/std - they return empty content
Do not rely on GitHub API for raw content - use raw.githubusercontent.com to avoid rate limits
Do not fetch full language reference without piping to head - it is ~500KB of text

faq.question: Which documentation source is most reliable?
faq.answer: Raw GitHub source files from raw.githubusercontent.com are most reliable and include doc comments.

faq.question: What tools are required?
faq.answer: This skill requires curl, pandoc, and jq installed on your system to fetch and parse documentation.

faq.question: Can I get version-specific docs?
faq.answer: Yes. Replace 'master' with a version tag like '0.14.0' in URLs for stable release documentation.

faq.question: Does this skill store any data?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides instructions for fetching documentation. No data is stored or cached.

faq.question: Why is ziglang.org documentation empty?
faq.answer: The std lib HTML docs at ziglang.org are JavaScript-rendered. Use raw GitHub source instead.

faq.question: How is this different from zig-best-practices?
faq.answer: zig-best-practices covers coding patterns and idioms. zig-docs provides raw documentation lookup.
